clinical_study.brief_title: Gastrointestinal Tolerance and Safety of an Infant Formula Containing Prebiotics, Probiotics and Postbiotics.
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label Single-arm Study to Investigate Gastrointestinal Tolerance, Safety, and Acceptability of a New Infant Formula Containing Prebiotics, Probiotics and Postbiotics, in Healthy Term Infants.

brief_summary.textblock: A study to investigate the gastrointestinal tolerance and safety of a new formula containing prebiotics, probiotics and postbiotics.

primary_outcome.description: A 13-item questionnaire where each item is scored on a scale of 1 to 5 with higher values indicating greater GI distress.
A 13-item questionnaire where each item is scored on a scale of 1 to 5 with higher values indicating greater GI distress.
A 13-item questionnaire where each item is scored on a scale of 1 to 5 with higher values indicating greater GI distress.
A 13-item questionnaire where each item is scored on a scale of 1 to 5 with higher values indicating greater GI distress.
A 13-item questionnaire where each item is scored on a scale of 1 to 5 with higher values indicating greater GI distress.

secondary_outcome.description: Parent reported daily stool consistency using stool scales with categories 1; watery, 2; loose, 3; formed, 4; hard
Parent reported daily stool consistency using stool scales with categories 1; watery, 2; loose, 3; formed, 4; hard
Parent reported daily stool consistency using stool scales with categories 1; watery, 2; loose, 3; formed, 4; hard

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence, frequency, and severity of (S)AEs, and relatedness to study product of (Serious) Adverse Events.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of one month

other_outcome.description: A parent reported 3-item questionnaire with individual scores from 1-5 (strongly agree, agree, neither agree nor disagree, disagree, strongly disagree)
A parent reported 3-item questionnaire with individual scores from 1-5 (strongly agree, agree, neither agree nor disagree, disagree, strongly disagree)
A parent reported evaluation of product characteristics with a categorical rating scale and open questions
A parent reported evaluation of product characteristics with a categorical rating scale and open questions
